meanings.definition: A person who brushes or cleans something.
meanings.sent1: The brusker at the zoo was busy cleaning the animal enclosures.
meanings.sent2: I hired a brusker to help me clean my car.
meanings.sent3: The brusker accidentally brushed the paint off the wall instead of cleaning it.
meanings.sent4: She was a brusker, gently cleaning the delicate artifacts in the museum.
meanings.sent5: The diligent brusker meticulously cleaned every corner of the room.

meanings.definition: To clean or tidy something by brushing.
meanings.sent1: I need to brusker the dust off these old books.
meanings.sent2: She will brusker the dirt off her shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent3: He decided to brusker the leaves off the sidewalk with a broom.
meanings.sent4: The wind bruskered the fallen petals across the garden.
meanings.sent5: The maid bruskered the carpet until it looked brand new.

meanings.definition: A tool used for brushing or cleaning.
meanings.sent1: The brusker was perfect for scrubbing the stubborn stains.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a brusker in my cleaning kit.
meanings.sent3: The brusker fell off the shelf and startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: She used the brusker to sweep away the cobwebs in the attic.
meanings.sent5: The brusker's bristles were soft yet effective in cleaning.
